recipes.name: Hot Mulled Cider
instructions: Slowly bring to a boil
Cover & simmer for 20 minutes
Remove spices

recipes.name: Cranberry Tea
instructions: Mix 1 quart of water with the sugar, red hots, and cloves
Bring to a boil and cook until sugar and red hots have dissolved
Strain and combine with cranberry juice
When ready to serve, add the rest of water, and the juice from the oranges and lemons
Serve Hot or Cold

recipes.name: Hot Cocoa Mix
instructions: Use 1/3 cup cocoa mix in 1 cup hot water

recipes.name: Cindy Smith's Punch
instructions: Mix all ingredients together

recipes.name: 7-Up Punch
instructions: Chill fruits ahead of time
Combine fruit in punch bowl
Stir in pineapple juice and grenadine
Pour in 7-UP slowly and mix gently
Add ice cubes

recipes.name: Slush Sparkle
instructions: Heat the water and sugar until dissolved
Add the juice and bananas
Pour into containers and freeze
Stir occasionally while freezing
Serve with 7-UP over top

recipes.name: Tomato Cocktail
instructions: Chill, serve and enjoy

recipes.name: Fruit Smoothies
ingredients: 1 cup of your favorite fruit (frozen, fresh or canned... we like pineapple, mango and blueberries)
instructions: Put all ingredients into blender and process until smooth

recipes.name: White Grape Punch
ingredients: 2 liter bottle of dry ginger ale
Fresh pineapple cubes and seedless green grapes to garnish
instructions: Mix all ingredients together

recipes.name: Summertime Slush
instructions: Combine and freeze 5-6 for slush
It will not freeze solid Keeps well in freezer
Use Dixie cups for individual servings

recipes.name: Chai Tea
ingredients: 5/8 cup French vanilla non-dairy creamer, dry
instructions: Combine all ingredients and mix well
Store in an airtight container
Yields 4 1/4 cups mix
To prepare: Add 3 rounded teaspoons in cup with boiling water
Note: 5/8 cup = 1/2 cup + 1/8 cup

recipes.name: Hot Spinach Artichocke Dip
ingredients: 1 jar (6 - 1/2 ounce) marinated artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
1 package (10 ounce) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well drained
instructions: In a skillet, saute artichokes and onion in butter until onion is tender
Stir in spinach and parmesan cheese
Cook over low heat until spinach is heated through
Add Colby/Monterey Jack cheese, milk, and Creole seasoning
Heat until cheese is melted
Serve immediately with vegetables, tortilla chips, or crackers

recipes.name: Fresh Fruit Dip
ingredients: 1 - 8 ounce package reduced fat cream cheese - strawberry flavored
1 package strawberry gelatin (can be sugar free)
instructions: Whip together
Refrigerate for a couple of hours
Cut up fruits
Insert toothpicks and dip

recipes.name: Chestnuts
instructions: Wrap bacon slices around chestnuts with a toothpick
Place on cookie sheet and bake @ 350 degrees for 1 hour
Place in crock pot
Pour sweet and sour sauce over chestnuts and serve warm

recipes.name: Cheese Ball
instructions: Mix together well, saving 1 cup pecans to roll cheese ball in
Refrigerate at least eight hours before serving

recipes.name: Little Smokies
instructions: Place in crock pot with enough sauce to cover
Cook on low 5-6 hours

recipes.name: Reuben Spread
ingredients: 1 pound can sauerkraut, drained and chopped
instructions: Mix well. Cover and bake @ 350 degrees for 30 minutes
Spread on cocktail Rye bread

recipes.name: Cheese Dreams
ingredients: 6 ounce Old English Sharp Cheese spread
instructions: Cut bread into 2 inch cubes
Whip cheese and butter and frost all sides of bread cubes
Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes

recipes.name: Taco Salad
instructions: Mix cream cheese, cottage cheese and taco seasoning together
Spread thin on 2 pizza pans
Chop up the vegetables
Sprinkle on top of cream cheese mixture
Top with shredded taco cheese
Scoop up with plain Tostados

recipes.name: Vegetable Dip
instructions: Mix together and chill

recipes.name: Fruit Dip
instructions: Mix all ingredients together

recipes.name: Caramel Apple Dip
instructions: Mix all ingredients together
Variation: Omit the caramel flavoring and add chopped peanuts, finely chopped

recipes.name: Apple Snickers
instructions: Cut up Apples and Snickers bars
Mix all ingredients together

recipes.name: Nuts And Bolts
instructions: Melt butter
Add worcestershire sauce, garlic and onion
Combine cereals, pretzels and nuts
Pour butter over ceareal mixture and stir well
Use a large turkey roaster with a cover
Put in oven for 1 hour
Bake at 250 degrees
Stir often

recipes.name: Joni's Wedding Chex Mix
instructions: Mix all ingredients together

recipes.name: Spinach Dip in a Bread Bowl
ingredients: 1 envelope (1 ounce) Ranch Salad Dressing Mix
1 - 10 ounce package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well drained
instructions: Combine first 6 ingredients and chill for at least an hour
Cut top off (1 1/2 inch) of loaf of bread
Hollow out loaf, leaving a thick shell
Save bread for dipping as well as raw vegetables

recipes.name: Chicken Pillows
instructions: Cut chicken 1 inch cubes
Combine remaining ingredients and add chicken
Marinate covered overnight in refrigerator
Melt butter
Unwrap phyllo and place on wax paper
Cover what you are not working with to prevent it from drying out
Cut Pastry in half with scissors lengthwise, giving you 2 long strips about 6 inches wide
Take one strip of phyllo, fold crosswise and brush with butter
Place 2 pieces of chicken at one short end and roll up in pastry to midpoint
Fold left and right edges toward center over filling and continue rolling; Forming a neat package
Brush entire package with butter and place seam side down on jelly roll pan
Repeat with remaining chicken and phyllo
Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes until golden brown
To freeze ahead, Place filled and buttered phyllo rolls on a large baking sheet and freeze
When frozen, transfer to large plastic bag and seal
To bake, Place frozen rolls on single layer on cookie sheet
Crush with butter
Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes

recipes.name: Bar-B-Q Ribs
instructions: Place ribs on roasting pan
Combine other ingredients and pour over ribs
Cover and bake at 325 degrees for 2 1/2 hours
Remove cover and bake an additional 30 minutes

recipes.name: Taco Casserole
instructions: Brown onion and garlic in oil-add meat for 5 minutes
Drain fat
Stir in tomato sauce and taco seasoning mix
Rinse and drain kidney beans
Mix beans with half of the cheese
Grease 9x13 inch casserole pan
Line bottom with 1/3 chips
Spread a layer of bean and cheese mixture
Add 1/3 chips and spread layer of meat mixture
Add remaining chips
Drizzle taco sauce over top
Add remaining cheese
Bake 25 minutes at 375

recipes.name: Corn Beef Casserole
instructions: Combine milk and soup
Layer noodles through cheese in order above
Pour milk mixture over top
Bake 35 minutes at 350 degrees
Add bread crumbs and bake an additional 10 minutes

recipes.name: Frikadellas (Norwegian Meatballs)
ingredients: 2 pounds ground meat (any combination of lean ground beef, pork, turkey)
instructions: Combine first 7 ingredients in a large bowl
Beat smooth
Mix in the ground meats
Blend thoroughly
Heat oil in a skillet
Drop meat mixture by rounded tablespoons into hot skillet
As they brown, flatten into patties (1/2 inch thick 2 inch diameter)
Brown well on both sides
Drain on paper towel
Place in covered casserol
Freeze to reheat later OR place in 350 degree oven in covered casserole dish for 20-30 minutes
additional: Traditional - Serve with lingonberries and sour cream
Our way - brown gravy and mashed potatoes
Also very good with barbeque sauce

recipes.name: Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 4 large green peppers (tops cut off and cleaned out)
instructions: Mix together ground beef, rice, egg and sauce in a bowl
Stuff green peppers full with hamburger mixture
Make excess hamburger mixture into large balls and place peppers and balls into 9x13 baking pan
Cover with tomato soup
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours
Serve and enjoy

recipes.name: Reuben Loaf
instructions: Set aside 1 cup flour
In a large bowl, mix remaining flour, sugar, salt and yeast
Stir in hot water and oleo
Mix in only enough reserved flour to make a soft dough
Knead 4 minutes
On greased baking sheet, roll dough in approximately 14x10 inch rectangle
Spread dressing down center third of dough lengthwise
Top with layers of beef, cheese and sauerkraut
Cut 1 inch wide strips along sides of filling of dough edges
Alternating sides, fold strips at an angle across the filling
Cover and place baking sheet over large shallow pan, half filled with boiling water for 15 minutes
Brush with egg white, sprinkle with sesame seeds
Bake 25 minutes at 400 degrees

recipes.name: Sloppy Joe
instructions: Saute onions, celery and green pepper
Brown meat
Add all other ingredients and simmer about 2 hours

recipes.name: Chop Suey Casserole
instructions: Combine, place in greased casserole dish
Bake at 425 for 30 minutes
Sprinkle top with Chinese noodles

recipes.name: Belly Burner Meat Balls
instructions: Combine and shape into 1 inch meatballs and simmer covered 10 minutes
Stir occasionally

recipes.name: Hamburger Pie
instructions: Combine flour, shortening and 1/2 tsp salt and place in pie pan
Top with 1/4 cup chopped onion
Brown beef
Add rest of ingredients and pour over crust
Topping #1
Top with 6 fresh tomato slices
Bake at 400 20-25 minutes
Add a slice of cheese on top of each tomato the last minute of baking
Just enough to melt the cheese
Topping #2
Make instant potato for 4 servings
Hold out milk
Add beaten egg
Then add just enough milk to make them right consistency
Place on top of meat filling
Bake at 400 20-25 minutes

recipes.name: Oven Swedish Meatballs
instructions: In a large bowl, combine beef, onion, bread crumbs, eggs and 1/2 of the cream, salt, pepper, allspice, and nutmeg
Form into small balls and place on lightly greased baking sheet
Bake at 350 for 20 minutes
Remove and keep warm warm while making sauce
Cook 2 tbsp fat from the baking pan along with the flour and beef broth, stirring constantly, just until bubbly
Stir in rest of cream and cook until sauce thickens about 1 minute
Add meatballs and simmer until meatballs are hot

recipes.name: Brown's BBQ Beef Supreme Sloppy Joes
ingredients: 6-8 sticks celery, chopped, cooked with meat and onions
instructions: Combine all ingredients
Does well in crock pot after draining fat from ground beef
Best when slow cooked for hours

recipes.name: Beautiful Baked Ziti
instructions: Cook sausage and penne according to package and coin slice sausage
In a large bowl, mix cooked sausage, pasta, pasta sauce, water, basil, garlic, parmesan and pepper
Toss gently
Place mixture into a greased 9x13 pan
Place 12 slices of garlic bread on top of mixture and cover with mozzerella
Bake uncovered at 400 for 30 minutes or until heated through
When I make this I double the pasta and I put in a ton of cheese. I also can't fit 12 slices of bread on the top

recipes.name: Sloppy Joe
instructions: Brown meat and onion
Drain fat
Add garlic salt, pepper, chili sauce, brown sugar, vinegar, mustard and tomato sauce
Bring to boil
Reduce heat
Simmer uncovered for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally

recipes.name: Beef Stroganoff
ingredients: 6 tbsp flour or 3 tbsp corn starch
instructions: Brown meat and onion
Add rest of ingredients except for sour cream
Cook noodles
Thicken sauce with flour or corn starch
Just before serving, add sour cream

recipes.name: Tater Tot Casserole
instructions: Crumble raw meat into 13x9 pan
Sprinkle onion on top
Mix Together soup and milk, pour over meat
Cover with tater tots
Bake at 400 degrees for 1 hour

recipes.name: Colorado Pie
ingredients: Pastry for 2 crust pie, using 1 tsp onion salt in pastry
instructions: Brown ground beef with onion
Add rest of the ingredients and pour into unbaked crust
Add top curst and cut slits in into
Bake at 400 for 25 minutes

recipes.name: Pizza Style Fondue
instructions: Brown meat and onion
Add pizza sauce and remaining ingredients, except cheese
Stir and cook about 5 minutes until it comes to a boil and thickens
Reduce heat to low
Combine cheeses
Add 1/3 at a time, stirring after each addition until melted
Place in fondue pot
Spear French bread cubes, English muffins, etc for dipping

recipes.name: Kathy's Spaghetti Sauce
instructions: Saute onion and garlic in oil
Add the rest of the ingredients
Simmer all ingredients 1-2 hours
If freezing - omit water and tomato paste and add before final cooking

recipes.name: Diane's Thick Pan Pizza
ingredients: 1 package yeast dissolved in 1/2 cup warm water
instructions: Mix flour, water, sugar, oil and yeast
Knead until elastic
Let rise for 15 minutes
Spread dough on 2 - 9x13 pans
Mix tomato sauce, basil, salt, garlic powder and pepper into a sauce
Layer mozzerella cheese, sauce, meat and more cheese
Sprinkle with oregano
Bake 20 minutes at 450 degrees

recipes.name: Stir Fried Beef and Broccoli
ingredients: 1 pound round steak, cut crosswise in thin slices
instructions: Marinate steak in 1/4 cup water, soy sauce, sugar, sherry, garlic, ginger and cornstarch at least 10 minutes
Drain, reserving marinade
Heat oil in skillet, add steak slices and stir until browned
Remove
Add broccoli and onion, then stir fry 1 minute
Add 1/4 cup water, cover and steam 3 minutes or until tender crisp
Return meat to marinade
Stir to heat through 4-6 servings

recipes.name: Rice and Peanut Gravy Beef
ingredients: 1 cup beef, cut into small pieces, browned in oil
instructions: Saute beef in oil until done
Add onion, pepper and tomatoes
Simmer a few minutes
Add peanut butter
Serve over cooked rice

recipes.name: Easy Pork Chops
ingredients: 2 cans creamed soup (mushroom, chicken, celery, chicken, onion)
instructions: Brown pork chops on stove
Put in a 9x13 pan
Mix together 2 cans of creamed soup (I usually use 2 different soups)
Mix in a little milk
Pour mixture over pork chops
Cover with foil
Bake slowly 2 1/2 - 3 hours at 325 degrees

recipes.name: Ham and Spaghetti
ingredients: 2 cups leftover ham, cut in julienne strips
instructions: In heavy skillet, brown bacon until cooked, but not crisp
Pour off fat
Set bacon aside
In same pan, add oil, butter, garlic and ham
Saute lightly over medium heat
Add cooked spaghetti, bacon, cheese, salt and pepper
Stir to mix well
Pour eggs over and toss quickly to evenly coat spaghetti
Remove from heat and transfer to warm serving platter
Serve immediately
Makes 4 servings

recipes.name: Chicken Salad
ingredients: Can add 2 - 3 cups shoestring potatoes just before serving, if desired
instructions: Mix all ingredients together

recipes.name: Cheesy Ham and Broccoli Casserole
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups cooked smoked ham, cut up
1 - 10 ounce package frozen broccoli, chopped and drained
1 can cream of mushroom or chicken soup
instructions: Mix ham, cheese, broccoli and soup in 1 1/2 quart casserole dish
Stir remaining ingredients until dough forms
Drop by spoonfuls evenly over vegetable mixture
Bake uncovered 40-50 minutes or until top is brown @ 350 degrees

recipes.name: Creamy Italian Chicken
ingredients: 1/2 pkg. Good Seasons Italian dressing packet
instructions: Place all ingredients in crock pot for 5 hours.

recipes.name: Chili-Cheese Black Bean Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 - 15 oz. can black beans, rinsed & drained
12 oz. extra lean ground beef - browned
1/3 c. (3 oz.) block-style fat free cream cheese, softened
1 c. shredded reduced-fat extra sharp cheddar cheese, divided
instructions: Spray pan with cooking spray, over medium high heat
add onion & saute 4 minutes or until tender
Stir in cumin, oregano, chili powder, garlic, beans, & beef
cook 2 minutes, stirring mixture frequently
Stir in salsa and cook 1 minute
Remove from heat & add cream cheese and 1/2 cup cheddar cheese, stirring until cheese melts.
Warm tortillas according to package directions.
Spread 1/3 c. enchilada sauce in bottom of 9 x 13 pan coated with cooking spray.
Spoon about 1/3 c. black bean mixture down center of each tortilla and roll up.
Arrange enchiladas, seam side down, crosswise in dish.
Pour remaining enchilada sauce evenly over enchiladas and sprinkle with 1/2 c. cheddar cheese.
Bake @ 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
Yield 6 servings.

recipes.name: Honey Baked Chicken
instructions: Combine oleo, honey, mustard, salt, and curry powder together and pour over chicken.
Bake 1 1/4 hours basting every 15 minutes until tender and browned. Good with rice.

recipes.name: Chicken and Broccoli Casserole
ingredients: 1 c. reduced fat shredded cheddar cheese
2 cans reduced fat cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Cube or shred chicken.
Partly cook broccoli.
Place broccoli in the bottom of a 9x13” pan.
Scatter chicken.
Combine soup, mayo, and lemon juice, pour over chicken.
Top with crumbs and cheese.
Bake @ 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Turkey Tetrazzini
ingredients: 1 -  8 oz. pkg. spaghetti noodles, cooked and drained
instructions: On high power in 3 qt. Casserole, heat butter 1-2 minutes until melted.
Stir in flour, salt, and pepper.
Add brother and cream, stir until smooth.
On medium power, heat 4-5 minutes until sauce is thickened.
Stir in rest of ingredients and warm through.

recipes.name: Chicken Rolls
instructions: Roll up cheese and ham in chicken breast and secure with 3 toothpicks.
Roll in parmesan cheese, salt, white pepper, and parsley.
Saute in canola oil.
Place in crock pot.
Add cream of mushroom soup and cooking wine.
Cook until tender.
Bake at 300 degrees for 1 hour.

recipes.name: Lasanga Primavera
ingredients: 2 medium green or red bell peppers (one of each looks pretty)
3 cups fresh or frozen (thawed) broccoli flowerets
2 containers (10 oz. each) refrigerated Alfredo sauce
instructions: Heat the oven to 350 degrees.
Boil noodles in a dutch oven 12-15 minutes until tender.
Peel and shred carrots by rubbing them across the largest holes of a grater. You need about 2 cups.
Cut bell peppers lengthwise in half and cut out seeds and membrane.
Chop bell peppers.
Cut broccoli flowerets into bite-size pieces if needed.
Drain tomatoes in a strainer.
Mix tomatoes, carrots, bell peppers, and broccoli.
Stir the ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, and egg until well mixed.
Drain noodles in a strainer or colander.
Spread 2/3 c. of the Alfredo sauce in an ungreased 9x13” pan.
Top with 3 noodles.
Spread half of the cheese mixture, 1/3 of the vegetable mixture, and 2/3 c. of the sauce over the noodles.
Sprinkle with 1 cup of the mozzarella cheese.
Top cheese with 3 noodles.
Spread remaining cheese mixture, 1/3 of the vegetable mixture, and 2/3 c. of the sauce over the noodles.
Sprinkle with 1 cup of the mozzarella cheese.
Top with remaining 3 noodles and vegetable mixture.
Pour remaining sauce evenly over the top.
Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake 30 minutes.
Carefully remove foil and continue baking about 30 minutes longer or until lasagna is hot in center.
Remove from oven and let stand 15 minutes. Cut and serve.

recipes.name: California Chicken - Crock Pot
ingredients: 3 med. oranges or 1-13 1/2 oz. can mandarin oranges
instructions: Arrange chicken quarters in bottom.
Pour other ingredients over chicken except green pepper and oranges.
Simmer on high 4 1/2-5 hours.
Add green pepper and oranges 30 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Chicken Alfredo Lasanga
instructions: Cut chicken breasts into bite size pieces.
Saute in oil with mushrooms and garlic until the chicken is no longer pink.
Stir in the flour til blended.
Stir Alfredo sauce and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 5 minutes.
In a small bowl, combine cottage cheese, 1/4 cup parmesan cheese, egg, seasoning, and parsley.
Spread 1/2 cup alfredo/chicken mix in an 8”x4”x2” loaf pan coated with cooking spray.
Layer with 2 noodles trimmed to fit pan.
Then 1/2 cup of cottage cheese mix, 3/4 cup alfredo mix, and then 3/4 cup mozzarella cheese.
Repeat layers and sprinkle remaining mozzarella cheese on top.
Cover and bake for 30 minutes at 350.
Then uncover and bake 10 minutes longer or until bubbly.

recipes.name: Chicken Couscous
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken breasts, cut into bite size pieces
1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
instructions: Mix cumin, ginger, cinnamon, and cayenne in large ziploc bag.
Add chicken and shake to coat.
Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet, then add chicken.
Saute until cooked through, about 8 minutes.
Transfer chicken to a plate and keep warm.
In the skillet, saute the bell pepper and scallions until softened.
Stir in raisins, orange juice, salt and water; bring to boil.
Stir in couscous.
Remove from heat, cover, and let stand until liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes.
Add the chicken, mix thoroughly with a fork.
Makes 4 servings. 8 WW points.

recipes.name: Holly's Impossible Chicken Broccoli Pie
instructions: Rinse broccoli to thaw, drain.
Mix broccoli, 2 cups cheese, chicken, and onion.
Beat milk, eggs, bisquick, salt and pepper until smooth. (about 1 minute)
Pour into greased pie plate.
Bake @ 400 degrees until knife inserted in center comes out clean 25-35 minutes.
Top with remaining cheese.
Bake until cheese is melted 1-2 minutes longer.
Cool 5 minutes.
Serves 6-8.

recipes.name: Kathy's Chicken and Rice
ingredients: 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 can condensed cream of celery soup
1 can condensed cream of chicken soup
instructions: Heat oven to 275 degrees
Lightly butter bottom of 3 qt. baking dish
Combine soups, butter & sherry
Divide in half
Mix rice with half of the soup mixture and pour in bottom of dish
Place chicken pieces (skin side up) in a single layer on top of soup
Spread remaining soup mixture over top of chicken
Sprinkle with almonds & cheese
Cover & back 2 1/2 hr or until chicken is fork tender
To brown chicken slightly, remove cover, increase oven to 400 degrees & bake for another 20 minutes

recipes.name: Kathy's Tacos de Gallina
ingredients: 2 c. tomato sauce with onion, garlic, basil, and oregano
instructions: Divide chicken up on tortillas
Pour gravy over chicken.
Roll tortillas up and place in 8x8” pan.
Pour tomato sauce over tortillas and add cheese.
Bake 375 for 20-30 minutes.

recipes.name: Tomato-Basil Chicken
ingredients: 1/4 t. Garlic powder, or 2 cloved garlic, minced
instructions: In medium skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil.
Add chicken and cook 10 minutes or until browned.
Set chicken aside.
Pour off fat.
Add soup, milk, cheese, basil, and garlic powder.
Heat to a boil.
Return chicken to pan.
Reduce heat to low.
Cover and cook 5 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.
Serve with pasta.

recipes.name: Fettuccine and Chicken in Herb Sauce
instructions: Cook fettuccine.
Melt margarine, add flour for white sauce.
Add bouillon, basil, garlic, pepper.
Add milk gradually, cook and stir until thick and bubbly.
Stir in chicken.
Heat through.
In large serving bowl, combine fettuccine, chicken and sauce and parsley.
Toss to coat.
Sprinkle parmesan on top.
6-8 servings.

recipes.name: Thai Chicken and Cashews
instructions: Heat oil (& fry chilies - optional) - chicken & onion, then garlic salt and turn, add celery, mushrooms, fish & soy sauces, and broth.
Cover and simmer 5 minutes.
Add cornstarch and  water until sauce thickens.
Add cashews right before serving.
Great on rice.

recipes.name: Frozen Fruit Cup
ingredients: Juice from 3 lemons and 3 oranges (1/2 c. each)
instructions: Boil water and sugar.
Pour into 9x13 pan.
Add rest of fruit and stir.
Freeze.
Thaw 15 minutes when ready to serve.
Cut into squares and pour 7-up over each portion.
great with chicken recipe - thai chicken and cashews

recipes.name: Chicken and Vegetable Lasagna - Crock Pot
instructions: Cook lasagna noodles, drain, and cut into thirds.
In skillet, saute onions, zucchini, carrot, and garlic.
Add cooked shredded chicken and season with spices.
Transfer to crock pot.
Add noodles to crock pot.
In bowl, mix white sauce ingredients, but only 1 cup of cheese.
Stir into crock pot.
Cover and cook 4 hours on low.
Last 30 minutes, top with remaining 1 c. cheese and turn to high.

recipes.name: Chicken Sate with Ponzu Sauce
ingredients: 4-6 oz. skinles, boneless chicken breast halves
instructions: Cut each chicken breast half lengthwise into 4 strips.
Combine sugar and remaining ingredients in a small bowl; stir until sugar dissolves.
Combine half of sake mixture and all of chicken in a large bowl.
Let stand 10 minutes.
Reserve remaining sake mixture.
Drain chicken, discarding marinade.
Thread chicken strips onto skewers.
Place chicken on grill rack coated with cooking spray; grill 2 minutes on each side until done.
Serve with remaining sake mixture.

recipes.name: Chicken Mushroom Crepes
instructions: Saute vegetables in butter/oil.
Cut up chicken in small pieces.
Mix all ingredients together, including rice.
After things have cooled down, add sour cream and cheddar cheese.
Put mixture in crepes.
Warm up in microwave or on cookie sheets in warm oven.
Make topping → whipped cream, dill, 4-5 T. grey poupon mustard Simmer and reduce liquid.
Spoon topping on warmed crepes.

recipes.name: Marinade for Tri-tip
ingredients: 2 medium shallots, minced (or equivalent of onion)
instructions: Cut off visible fat and cut up tri-tip into smaller pieces.
In large ziploc bag, marinade meat, refrigerate and marinate 6-8 hours.
Grill.

recipes.name: Lettuce and Mandarine Orange Salad
instructions: Heat sugar (3 T.) and almonds in a non-stick pan until sugar melts and coats nuts.
Spoon out onto foil and then break apart.
Mix 2 T. sugar, red wine vinegar, salt, pepper, tabasco sauce, and olive oil together for the dressing.
Mix the veggies and oranges, drizzle with dressing, top with sugared almonds.

recipes.name: Linda's Sweet and Sour Dressing
instructions: Combine sugar, mustard, salt, onion, and 2 T. vinegar. Mix in blender.
Add oil very slowly with blender on.
Add remaining vinegar and lemon juice until thick.
Stir in celery seed and salt.
Store covered in refrigerator at least one day ahead for best flavor.

recipes.name: Korean Salad
ingredients: 1 lb. spinach - washed, drained, and broken up
instructions: *Mix starred ingredients together for the dressing the day before.

recipes.name: Gourmet Salad
instructions: Combine salt, pepper, salad oil, tabasco sauce, sugar, vinegar, and parsley and shake well.
Store in refrigerator overnight.
Carmelize almonds and sugar until brown.
Chop up lettuce, romaine lettuce, celery, and scallions and place in plastic bag overnight in refrigerator.
Before serving, add mandarin oranges.

recipes.name: Layered Overnight Salad
ingredients: 1 lb. bacon, fried crisp and crumbled
instructions: In large bowl, place ingredients in layers as listed above.
Cover bowl so it is air tight and store in refrigerator overnight or for several hours.
Toss just before serving.
For a family of 4 make 1/4 recipe.

recipes.name: Sweet Potato Hash
instructions: Place sweet potatoes and 1/3 c. water in large microwave-safe bowl
Cover with plastic wrap & microwave on HIGH 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender
Carefully uncover; drain & keep warm.
Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over med-high heat.
Remove casings from sausage.
Add onion to pan; sauté 6 minutes or until tender.
Add sausage & 4/4 t. salt;
cook 4 minutes or until sausage is done, stirring to crumble.
Stir in sweet potatoes, 42 t. salt, syrup, 1 T. water, pepper & nutmeg.
Cook until liquid is absorbed & sweet potatoes begin to brown (about 5 minutes).
Yield 4 servings

recipes.name: Au Gratin Potatoes
ingredients: 1 pkg. 32 oz. hash brown frozen potatoes
instructions: Mix above ingredients & put in greased shallow 9 x 13 pan
Bake 1 1/2 hrs. @ 350 degrees
Can be made ahead & frozen

recipes.name: Mashed Potato Casserole
instructions: Bake @ 400 for 20 minutes. Serves 6-8

recipes.name: Pizza Potatoes
instructions: Sauté potato & onion in oil, drain well.
Combine potatoes, onions, cheese, salt & pepperoni.
Pour pizza sauce over top.
Cook in slow cooker covered on low for 6-10 hours or until potatoes are soft.

recipes.name: Hidden Valley Ranch Potatoes
ingredients: 1 packet Hidden Valley Ranch Dressing dry mix
instructions: Place potatoes in a plastic bag, add oil.
Toss and coat.
Add dressing mix; toss again until coated.
Bake on ungreased baking pan at 450 degrees for 35 minutes.

recipes.name: Banana Pineapple Salad
ingredients: 1 c. crushed pineapple, well drained – save juice
8 large chopped marshmallows (or equivalent of small)
instructions: Combine jello and boiling water and let set until partly congealed
Add pineapple, marshmallows and bananas
Chill until firm.
Add water to pineapple juice to make 1 cup.
Add sugar and cornstarch
Mix together with one well beaten egg yolk.
Cook well, stirring constantly.
Cool.
Fold in heavy whipped cream
Spread over firm gelatin mixture.
Grate American cheese over top.
Cover.

recipes.name: 7-Up Salad
instructions: Salad:
Dissolve jello in water, let cool.
Add 7-up, marshmallows & pineapple.
Use 9 x 13 baking dish or pan.
Put in refrigerator until thickened.
Spread topping on firm jello mixture.
Topping:
Cook until thickened.
Cool & fold in 2 c. cool whip.
Sprinkle with mild grated cheese & chopped walnuts.

recipes.name: Linda's Sparkling Fruit Mold
ingredients: 2 - 3 oz. pkg. sparkling white grape jello
2 c. cold club soda, seltzer or diet sprite
instructions: Dissolve gelatin in water.
Refrigerate 15 min.
Gently stir in soda.
Refrigerate 30 minutes on until slightly thickened.
Stir in fruit.
Cover & Refrigerate.

recipes.name: Mississippi Corn Bread Salad
ingredients: 2 -15 oz. cans pinto beans, rinsed and drained
2 -15 oz. cans whole kernel corn, drained
1 c. chopped red and/or green sweet peppers
1 - 1 oz. package ranch salad dressing mix
instructions: Prepare muffin mix according to directions; cool.
Crumble muffins. (You should have about 5 cups crumbs.)
Crumble bacon.
Set crumbs & bacon aside.
In a large bowl, stir together tomatoes, beans, corn, sweet peppers, & onions; set aside.
For dressing, in a small mixing bowl, stir together mayonnaise, sour cream, & salad dressing mix; set aside.
In a 3-4 quart glass serving bowl, layer half of the crumbled corn bread, bean mixture, bacon & cheese.
Spread with dressing mixture.
Repeat layers.
Cover & chill for 3 to 24 hours.

recipes.name: Ramen Noodle Salad
ingredients: 1/2 c. almonds, sunflower seeds or cashews
instructions: Combine oil, sugar, vinegar and Ramen Noodles seasoning
Pour over cabbage & onion mixture.
Just before serving add Ramen Noodles and almond, sunflower seeds or cashews

recipes.name: Marilee's 3 Bean Salad
instructions: Drain all beans
Add remaining ingredients

recipes.name: Ann's Fruit Salad
ingredients: 1 lg. can. mandarin oranges - cut in half drain
1 lg, can pineapple chunks - cut in half but save juice
1 lg. can pears - cut up Few maraschino cherries for color
instructions: Cook & cool.
Pour over fruit.
Keeps well in refrigerator.

recipes.name: Vegetable Salad
instructions: Make dressing day before: Mix mayo, sugar, and vinegar
Break cauliflower, broccoli, onion, chees and bacon into bite sized pieces

recipes.name: Marinated Vegetables
instructions: Combine oil, vinegar and sugar
Add remaining ingredients

recipes.name: Marilee's Broccoli and Grape Salad
instructions: Salad: Mix broccoli, bacon, grapes, almonds, onion, celery and raisins
Dressing: Mix milk, vinegar, Miracle Whip and sugar
Pour dressing over just before serving.
Serves 8 - 10.

recipes.name: German Potato Salad
ingredients: 3 lb. red potatoes, cooked, cooled & sliced
instructions: In-between layers of potatoes, add cut up onion, salt & pepper.
Heat bacon fat.
Mix flour in water & add along with vinegar & sugar to bacon fat.
Bring to a boil & cook until slightly thickened.
Pour over prepared potatoes & serve warm.

recipes.name: Susie's Vegetable Casserole
ingredients: 1 c. French fried onions (2.8 oz. can)
instructions: Thaw & drain vegetables.
Combine soup, half of the cheese, sour cream, pepper & half of the onion pieces.
Add drained vegetables.
Place in greased 1 quart covered casserole dish.
Bake @ 350 for 30 minutes.
Top with remaining cheese & onion pieces.
Bake uncovered 5 more minutes.

recipes.name: Candied Sweet Potatoes
ingredients: 1 - 17 oz. can sweet potatoes sliced 1/2 inch thick
instructions: Mix & heat sugar, butter, cream and salt until bubbly
Add potatoes & cook long enough to heat the potatoes throughout.

recipes.name: Green Bean Casserole
instructions: Stir soup, milk, salt, pepper, beans and 1 1/3 cups onions in 3-qt. casserole.
Bake at 350 degrees F. for 25 min. or until hot. Stir.
Top with remaining onions. Bake for 5 min. more.

recipes.name: Linda's Cheesy Broccoli Bake
ingredients: 8 oz. can sliced water chestnuts, drained
instructions: Cut up broccoli into 1” pieces. Cook in boiling water & 1/2 t. salt, 5-8 min. or until crisp tender, drain
Sauté onion, celery & mushrooms in oleo until tender, drain.
Combine mushroom mixture, broccoli & water chestnuts stirring gently-set aside.
Combine American cheese & soup.
Cook over low heat until cheese melts.
Stir in garlic salt & pepper.
Pour over broccoli mixture.
Spoon into greased 2 qt. casserole.
Bake @ 350 degrees 25 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheddar cheese & bake 5 minutes more.

recipes.name: Onion Pie
ingredients: 1 1/2 c. scalded milk to 3 beaten eggs
instructions: Make a crust of crushed saltine crackers & 1/2 c. of melted butter.
Sauté onions in 1/4 c. butter until golden brown.
Put these on top of cracker crumbs in shallow casserole.
Sprinkle cheese on top of onions.
This may be fixed hours ahead of time.
When time to put in oven, add milk, eggs, salt and pepper
Pour mixture over the onion cheese mixture in casserole.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1/2 hour or until custard sets.

recipes.name: Chi-Chi's Sweet Corn Cake
instructions: Blend butter in medium bowl with electric mixer 'til creamy.
Add the masa harina & water to the butter & combine well.
Put the defrosted corn into a blender & with short pulses, coarsely chop the corn on low speed.
Stir the chopped corn into the butter & masa harina mixture.
Add the cornmeal.
In another medium bowl, mix together the sugar, cream, salt & baking powder.
Blend well & pour this mixture into the other bowl, & stir all by hand.
Pour the corn batter into an ungreased 8x8” baking pan.
Smooth the surface of the batter with spatula.
Cover the pan with aluminum foil.
Place this pan in a 9x13 pan filled 1/3 of the way with hot water.
Bake for 50-60 minutes.
Remove the small pan from the larger pan, & let sit for 10 minutes.
To serve, scoop out each portion.

recipes.name: Zucchini Casserole
instructions: Cook zucchini & carrots until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain.
In large saucepan, sauté onion in 4 T. oleo.
Stir in only 1/2 c. stuffing mix, soup, & sour cream.
Gently stir in vegetables.
Place in a greased 1 1/2 qt. casserole dish.
Melt remaining 2 T. oleo, add remaining stuffing mix.
Toss gently & sprinkle over casserole.
Bake 30 minutes @ 350 degrees.

recipes.name: Linda's 5 Way Beans
instructions: Mix all ingredients, except cheese.
Use the juice from the beans.
Place in greased baking dish.
Bake covered for 2 hours @ 350 degrees.
You can freeze for later use at this point.
Add cheese & bake 1 hour longer, uncovered.
Cover & allow to set 20-30 min. before serving.

recipes.name: Marilee's Golden Cheddar Broccoli Bake
instructions: Melt 2 T. margarine, stir in flour & salt.
Gradually add milk, mixing until smooth.
Add cheese, stirring until melted.
Mix in 1/4 c. cornflake crumbs & corn.
Arrange broccoli in 11 3/4 x 7 1/2 baking dish.
Pour cheese over broccoli: Toss remaining 1/2 c. cornflake crumbs with 2 T. melted margarine. Sprinkle over casserole.
Bake @ 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
To make ahead, cover unbaked & refrigerate overnight.
Bake uncovered @ 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

recipes.name: Marilee's Calico Beans
ingredients: 2 rounded T. Lipton onion soup mix
instructions: Combine in dish.
Bake 1 hour or so @ 350 degrees.

recipes.name: Diane's Del Monico Potatoes
instructions: Thaw potatoes.
Make sauce by melting butter; add flour, then slowly add milk, stirring constantly.
When sauce is thickened, add spices.
Stir in 1 c. cheese & potatoes.
Pour into greased baking dish.
Top with 1/2 c. cheese.
Bake @ 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Boston Baked Beans
ingredients: I small smoked butt, cut into cubes
instructions: Sort & rinse beans.
Cover with warm water & soak overnight.
Drain water off in the morning.
Using just enough fresh water to cover beans, simmer about 1 hour until tender.
Add remaining ingredients
Bake @ 300 degrees for 8 hours.
Remove cover last 1/2 hour.
Can use a crock pot.

recipes.name: Diane's Carrot Casserole
instructions: Cook carrots until tender/crisp - drain.
In medium pan, melt 1/4 c. oleo - add onions & cook 5 minutes.
Stir in flour, stirring constantly until smooth.
Add milk & next 4 ingredients.
Cook & stir until thickened.
In a small pan, melt 3 T. oleo, add bread crumbs & toss until coated.
Lightly grease a 2 qt. casserole dish.
Pour half of the carrots into the dish, layer with half of the cheese slices. Repeat.
Pour sauce over all.
Sprinkle with crumbs.
Bake 20 min. until hot @ 350 degrees.

recipes.name: Linda's Super Rice
instructions: Lightly brown rice, celery & onion in butter in large fry pan.
Crush bouillon cubes & dissolve in boiling water.
Sprinkle salt, marjoram & savory over rice mixture.
Stir in bouillon, cover tightly & cook slowly 20-25 min.
Fold in mushrooms, almonds & parsley just before serving.

recipes.name: Kathryn's Pickled Beets
instructions: Quarter small beets, eighths for larger ones

recipes.name: Gary and Beas's Pickles
instructions: Bring to a boil.
Cut cukes in NARROW strips & pack into jars.
Add a slice of onion, a clove of garlic, cut in half, & 2-3 heads of dill.
Pour boiling brine over pickles in jars.
Add lids.
Process 5 minutes in water bath.
Let cool in hot water.

recipes.name: Candied Dill Pickles
instructions: Quarter the dill pickles lengthwise.
Wash in cold water & drain.
Mix sugar, vinegar and spices into a syrup
(Put whole cloves in a small bag so they can be easily removed)
Bring syrup to a boil & pour over dill pickles.
Let stand overnight.
In the morning drain off the syrup, reheat it & pour over the pickles.
Let stand overnight.
Repeat this process, one more time.
When cool, remove spices & enjoy.
Note: 3 cups of syrup covers a 1/2 qt jar of sliced pickles.

recipes.name: VCY Refrigerator Pickles
instructions: Stir vinegar, sugar and salt until dissolved: DO NOT HEAT THIS!
When thoroughly dissolved, pour over pickles & keep in refrigerator.
Add dill heads.

recipes.name: Wild Rice Soup
ingredients: Enough wild rice to make 3 cups after cooking
1/2 lb. cubed Velveeta cheese (can be light)
instructions: Cook enough wild rice to make 3 cups after cooking.
Sauté chopped carrots in margarine; add minced onion
Add milk
Add cream of potato soup
Gradually add cheese
Add cubed ham
Add wild rice
Heat to warm, but don't boil as it might separate; stir occasionally to avoid burning.

recipes.name: Taco Soup
instructions: Brown beef and onion
Add remaining ingredients using juice from beans:
Serve with taco chips, sour cream & shredded cheese.

recipes.name: Taco Soup
ingredients: 2 beef bouillon cubes (or 1 can beef broth)
instructions: Combine all ingredients;
Cook in Crock Pot 2-4 hours on high, or 8+ hours on low; or on stove,
Simmer 1-2 hours, replenishing water as it cooks down.

recipes.name: Creamy Onion Spinach Soup
instructions: Roughly chop all onions, cook 10 min or until soft.
Add broth, potato, peeled & diced & garlic.
Cover and cook 1 hour.
Remove from heat; stir in spinach.
Carefully, puree in blender.
Return soup to pan.
Add milk.
Heat just to boiling (do not boil).
Add salt & pepper.
Top with croutons.

recipes.name: Cheese-Broccoli Soup
ingredients: 1-20 oz. bag frozen chopped broccoli, thawed
instructions: Sauté onion in margarine until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Reduce heat to low & stir in flour, salt & pepper to make a smooth paste.
Cook, stirring 3-5 min.
Stir in hot milk.
Simmer 5-10 min., stirring constantly, until mixture thickens.
Meanwhile, combine water, bouillon & broccoli.
Cover & cook until tender, about 5 min.
Add cooked broccoli to white sauce.
Stir in cheese & cook, stirring constantly, over med.
Heat until melted

recipes.name: Dad's Vegetable Soup
instructions: Cook beef roast in broth.
While beef is cooking, cut up onions, celery, & carrots, add to broth.
When beef is tender, cut up in chunks.
Add green beans, corn or any combination of vegetables you like.
Last 15 minutes add cut up or shredded head of cabbage.

recipes.name: Carrot Jalapeno Soup
ingredients: 3 slices bacon, cut crosswise into 1/4 inch pieces
1 - 2 jalapeno chilies, seeded and finely chopped
1/8 to 1/4 t. crushed red pepper flakes
instructions: Cook bacon until crisp, about 7 minutes.
Add carrots, onion & celery cook, stirring, until onion is softened, about 10 minutes.
Add jalapeno, garlic & red pepper flakes & cook, stirring until garlic is golden, about 3 minutes.
Add wine to pot & boil, stirring & scraping up brown bits, about 30 seconds.
Add chicken broth & bring to a boil, then reduce heat & simmer until vegetables are very soft, about 20 minutes.
Remove from heat & puree in batches in a blender until smooth,
(be careful when blending hot liquids).
Return soup to pot & bring to a boil over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally.
Stir in cheese until smooth & remove from heat, then stir in cream, salt & pepper.
Season with salt.

recipes.name: She Crab Soup
ingredients: 2 c. milk 1 # lump crab meat (imitation works great)
instructions: Cook first three ingredients in water until tender.
Puree, then add remaining ingredients
Season to taste: salt, pepper & Creole seasoning

recipes.name: Souper Chili
ingredients: 1 can bean & bacon soup (with one can water)
1 can tomato soup (with one can water)
1 large can chili con carne with beans
instructions: Brown meat & drain.
Brown onion.
Add other ingredients.
Bring to a boil & simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve with flour tortillas.

recipes.name: Pizza Dough
ingredients: 1 pkg. yeast dissolved in 1/2 cup water
instructions: Mix and knead ingredients till elastic.
Cover & let rise in warm place 20 minutes
Spread out on 3 round pizza pans.
Add favorite sauce (tomato or white).
Add favorite toppings: cheese, sausage, pepperoni, ham, pineapple, sautéed onions, peppers, mushrooms, black olives, etc.

recipes.name: Marilee's Zucchini Bread
instructions: Beat eggs until light & fluffy.
Add zucchini, sugar, oil & vanilla.
Mix well.
Add dry ingredients and fold into nuts.
Combine with liquid ingredients.
Grease loaf pans.
Bake @350 degrees for 1 hour.

recipes.name: Honey Buns
instructions: Heat oven to 425 degrees.
Grease 9 inch round pan.
Mix baking mix, sugar, whipping cream, nutmeg, and egg until dough forms.
Gently smooth dough into a ball on cloth-covered board dusted with baking mix.
Knead 10 times.
Divide dough into 16 equal parts; shape each part into a ball.
Place 12 balls around the edge of the pan; place 4 balls in center.
Bake until golden brown; 15-17 minutes.
Remove from pan.
Spread honey over buns, sprinkle with pecans.

recipes.name: Holly's Potato Dough
instructions: Dissolve yeast into water
Mix milk, potatoes, butter and sugar in large bowl:
Let cool to lukewarm, then add yeast mixture & 6 c. flour.
Let stand until foams up (about 20 min.)
Add eggs, salt and flour
Turn out on floured surface & knead until satiny.
Let rise 'til double.
Shape into rolls.
Place on greased pans.
Bake roll 15 minutes @ 400 degrees.
Brush tops lightly with butter to remove any floury appearance.
Cool Completely before freezing.
Makes 100 rolls.

recipes.name: Holly's Honey Whole Wheat Bread
instructions: Combine 3 c. whole wheat flour, milk, salt and yeast in mixer bowl
Heat water, honey and oil until warm, then pour over flour mixture.
Beat with electric mixer for 3 minutes.
Stir in 1 c. whole wheat flour and white flour.
Knead 5 minutes.
Place in greased bowl, turn & let rise until doubled.
Punch down.
Divide in half & shape into loaves.
Place in greased bread pans.
Cover & let rise 40 – 45 min.
Bake 40 - 45 min @ 375 degrees.

recipes.name: Carmel Bubble Rolls
ingredients: 1 1/2 loaves frozen bread OR 18 - 20 frozen rolls
1 pkg. (4 3/4) vanilla or butterscotch pudding (COOKED KIND)
instructions: Grease 9 X 13 inch pan.
Cut bread dough into small pieces & place in pan. (If using the bread, let it thaw a few hours first so you can cut the bread, otherwise just place the rolls in the pan.)
Pour pudding mix over bread.
Add 1 cup chopped pecans if desired.
Mix melted butter with brown sugar.
Pour over pudding mix.
Sprinkle a bit of cinnamon over everything if desired.
Place a light cloth over pan and let rise overnight on counter.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Invert on a plate and eat.

recipes.name: Grandma Conklyn's Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients: 1 c. warm water to dissolve Yeast
instructions: Add 1 t. sugar to water, then add yeast.
Mix together other ingredients; add yeast & enough flour to make a soft dough. About 6 cups flour.
Knead & let rise to double.
Divide into thirds.
Roll out dough, spread softened butter over dough & cover with cinnamon mixed with sugar.
Roll up, cut, place into greased pans.
Let rise. When dough is rising, cover with a light dish towel.
Bake @ 350 25-30 min.

recipes.name: Krantz
instructions: Scald milk & cool slightly.
When warm, add yeast & sugar.
Work shortening & butter into flour & lemon rind.
Blend as pie crust.
Add 4 egg yolks & yeast mixture & work into a ball.
Refrigerate overnight.
Beat egg whites until stiff.
Add 1 c. sugar slowly, then add vanilla.
Divide into 3 pieces.
On a floured cloth, roll into a long narrow piece.
Thin like a pie crust.
Spread 1/3 of the egg whites over the dough, sprinkle with nuts.
Fold together lengthwise & twist.
Place in a greased, circular cake pan.
Let rise 1/2 hour.
Bake @ 400 for 10 min. then reduce heat to 350 degrees until done.
Cinnamon & sugar can be used in place of nuts.

recipes.name: Banana Nut Bread
instructions: Bake @350 for 55 min.

recipes.name: Christmas Stolen
ingredients: 2 c. citron/candied fruit (orange peel/pineapple, cherries etc.)
instructions: Scald milk; add sugar, salt & butter.
Cool to luke warm, & add yeast & 1 T. sugar.
Add eggs & beat.
Then add 3 c. flour.
Beat well.
Cover, let rise 1 1/2 hours, or until double.
Add other ingredients & enough flour (about 2 2/3 c.) until dough pulls away from side of bowl & is no longer sticky to the touch.
Knead on floured board until smooth and satiny.
Place in lightly greased bowl.
Cover, Let rise 1 1/2 hrs, or until doubled.
Divide dough into thirds.
Roll into 8” x 10” oval.
Spread with melted butter.
Press down center & fold in half lengthwise.
Place on greased pan.
Brush with melted better.
Let rise 45 min. or until double.
Bake @ 350 for 30 min.
Cool. Frost & decorate with cherries & nuts.
Icing:
1 1/2 lbs. powdered
1/2 pt. cream
vanilla
1 t. Lt. Karo syrup

recipes.name: Parmesan Rolls
instructions: Make 1 recipe of biscuits or use canned refrigerated kind.
Cut rounds in half to make half circles.
Melt 1/2-1 stick margarine in 9 X 9 pan.
Sprinkle melted butter with parsley flakes, minced onion and Parmesan or Romano cheese
Place half circles in rows on top of butter mixture, over-lapping each roll
Bake @ 350 until brown.
Turn upside down on platter to serve.

recipes.name: Mom's Butterhorn Rolls
ingredients: 1 large cake of yeast + 1 tsp. sugar - sprinkle sugar over yeast
instructions: In a big bowl mix well the eggs, margarine, sugar, salt and water
Then add the flour.
Let rise until double.
Cut into 4 parts.
Roll into rounds and cut each round into 16 pieces
Bake 15 min. @ 400 degrees.

recipes.name: Kathy's Cranberry Bread
instructions: Mix, but do not overbeat. Grease pans.
Bake 1 hour @ 350 degrees

recipes.name: Mom's Banana Bread
instructions: Spray bread pans.
Bake 25 - 30 min @ 350 degrees.
Variations: Add chocolate chips

recipes.name: Pumpkin Bread
instructions: Beat together, sugar, oil & eggs, add pumpkin.
Add flour mixture alternately with water.
Grease 2 loaf pans.
Bake 1 hour @ 350 degrees or until done.

recipes.name: Bran Muffins
instructions: Pour hot water over bran cereal.
Cream shortening & sugar.
Add eggs, milk, & bran mix.
Fold in dry ingredients just to moisten.
Bake 15-20 min @ 400 degrees.
Batter will keep 6-7 weeks in refrigerator.

recipes.name: Cranberry Almond Sour Cream Bread
instructions: Cream: combine sour cream, eggs, butter and almond extract
Combine and add the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt
Spray Pam in 3 loaf pans.
Using 1/2 of batter, put some in bottom of the 3 pans.
Divide cranberry sauce between the 3 pans & place on top of the batter.
Cover the cranberry sauce with the remaining batter.
Sprinkle 2/3 c. slivered almonds on top of each loaf.
Bake 55 min. @ 375 degrees.

recipes.name: Holly's Oatmeal Bread
instructions: Sprinkle quick oats, whole wheat flour, brown sugar, salt and margarine over 2 c. boiling water.
Stir to combine.
Dissolve yeast in 1/2 c. warm water.
When batter is cooled to lukewarm, add yeast. ‘
Stir in white flour.
When dough is stiff enough to handle, turn onto floured board & knead 5-10 min.
Place in greased bowl, cover & let rise until doubled.
Punch down & let rise again.
Shape into 2 loaves & place in greased 9 x 5x 3” pans.
Bake 30 – 40 min. @ 350 degrees.
Cool on rack, brushing loaves with margarine for a soft crust.

recipes.name: Blueberry Oatmeal Muffins
instructions: Place oats in a food processor; pulse 5-6 times until oats resemble coarse meal.
Place in a large bowl.
Lightly spoon flours into dry measuring cups; level with a knife.
Add flours & next 5 ingredients (through salt) to oats in bowl; stir well with a whisk.
Make a well in center of mixture.
Combine buttermilk, oil, rind & eggs in small bowl; stir well with a whisk.
Add to flour mixture, stirring just until moist.
Pour into lined muffin tins. Bake 12-15 min. @ 375 degrees.

recipes.name: Breakfast Egg-Souffle
ingredients: 6 slices bread, broken into small pieces
instructions: In large skillet, cook sausage & bacon until brown & bacon is crisp 10-15 min.
Drain well.
In bowl, beat eggs & milk.
Stir in sausage & rest of ingredients.
Pour into greased 9 x 13 pan.
Cover and refrigerate over night.
Bake uncovered @ 350 50-60 min.
Serves 12-16

recipes.name: Sunny Frittata
ingredients: 1/4 c. (1 oz) reduced-fat shredded cheddar cheese
instructions: Combine eggs, milk, salt & pepper in a small bowl, stirring well with a whisk.
Heat a medium nonstick skillet over med-high heat.
Coat pan with spray.
Add ham, bell pepper & onions; sauté 2 min.
Stir in egg mixture.
Reduce heat to medium & cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally for first 2 minutes.
Top mixture with cheese.
Slide mixture onto a cookie sheet
Place in 375 degree oven for 12 minutes or until center is set.

recipes.name: Crepes
instructions: Combine & beat ingredients 'til smooth.
In a large frying pan over medium heat, pour ~1/4 cup of batter on the bottom & tilt the pan around to evenly coat the bottom.
Cook 'til light brown (makes around 12).
Add your filling and roll up to enjoy.
Variations:
I like to put butter, cinnamon & sugar on mine.
Evan puts peanut butter & sweetener.
Dylan puts lemon juice over his with cinnamon & sugar...the possibilities are endless!
They freeze well.

recipes.name: Holly's Pancake Mix
ingredients: 12 cups flour (may use some whole wheat or wheat germ)
instructions: Mix well and store in airtight container.
TO USE: Combine in bowl:
1 egg (beat with fork)
1 cup water
2 T. oil
1 1/2 c. pancake mix
Fry on hot ungreased griddle
Serves 3 - 4

recipes.name: Kathy's Whole Wheat Pancakes
ingredients: 3 c. milk (buttermilk or sour fresh (by adding 2 T. vinegar or lemon juice & letting it set))
instructions: Mix milk, eggs, oil and brown sugar
Then add whole wheat flour, flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda

recipes.name: Christmas Eggs
instructions: Beat eggs first.
Add flour, baking powder & salt.
By hand, add butter, sour cream, chives & cheese.
Bake @ 350 for 30-35 minutes.

recipes.name: Scrambled Eggs and Noodles
ingredients: 6 T. butter onion, chopped & cooked Worcestershire sauce
instructions: Cook egg noodles.
Melt butter in skillet; stir-fry cooked noodles & onions briefly.
Combine rest of ingredients & pour over noodles.
Stir slightly as eggs cook.

recipes.name: Breakfast Casserole
ingredients: 1 c. reduced fat shredded cheddar cheese
instructions: Layer crescent rolls in 8 or 9” square or round ungreased pan.
Mix eggs, cheese, frozen broccoli, cooked bacon & potatoes, milk, salt & pepper or seasoned salt to taste in a bowl.
Pour over rolls in pan.
Bake @ 350 degrees for 45-60 minutes. Check for doneness.
May add chopped onions if desired before baking.

recipes.name: Coffee Cake Streusel
instructions: Cut ingredients together until crumbly.
Can be kept in refrigerator for weeks.

recipes.name: Cake Cookies
instructions: Mix cake, egg, oil, and water.
Put in freezer for about one hour.
Take a spoonful of dough and roll it around a Rollo.
Then roll in crushed nuts (Optional).
Works best if you keep dough in freezer between pans.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10-15min (or until it smells like chocolate cake).
Makes about 3 dozen.

recipes.name: Christmas Jello
ingredients: 1 can cranberry sauce (jelly) mashed with fork
1/2 pt. Sour cream (beat with fork until smooth before adding)
instructions: Dissolve jello in hot water
Add cold water and let jell slightly

recipes.name: Cartwheel Desserts
instructions: Slice jelly roll & line spring form pan on sides, line bottom with remaining pieces. It will take about 8 slices around the sides.
Combine jello, water and suger then chill.
When it starts to congeal a little, beat it a little, then add 1 pt. whipped whipping cream.
Fill center & put in ice box over night.
You can decorate top with whipped cream & strawberries.
Just before serving, remove sides only of spring form pan.

recipes.name: Key Lime Pie
ingredients: 2 (6 oz) Key lime pie light yogurt
8 oz. Fat free cool whip, thawed
instructions: Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.
Stir in yogurt with wire whisk.
Fold in whipped topping.
Spread in crust.
Refrigerate overnight or at least 2 hours.

recipes.name: Cherry or Blueberry Dessert
ingredients: 1 can cherry pie filling or (Blueberry pie filling)
instructions: Put into a greased 8 x 8 brownie pan in the order given above
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour & 15 minutes or until if feels quite firm.

recipes.name: Fluffy Strawberry Frosting
ingredients: 1 - 10 OZ. pkg. frozen strawberries thawed & undrained
2 c. whipping cream or dream whip
instructions: Melt marshmallows
Add lemon juice, then strawberries.
Fold into cream.
Great on angel food or pound cake.

recipes.name: Rhubarb Crunch
instructions: Mix like pie crust: flour, margarine, cinnamon, brown sugar and oatmeal
Boil until thick: sugar, hot water, corn starch and salt
Press 3/4 of crust mix into bottom of greased 9 x 13 pan.
Place a thick layer of chopped rhubarb on top; then pour boiled mixture over fruit.
Sprinkle with remaining crust on top.
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

recipes.name: Linda's Pumpkin Pie Cake
instructions: Combine all but 1 1/2 c. cake mix, 1/2 c. oleo & 1 egg.
Press into bottom of 9 x 13 pan
Mix pumpkin, 3 eggs, milk, cinnamon and 1 c. sugar and Pour over cake mix layer
Mix 1 1/2 c. cake mix, 1/2 c. sugar and 1/4 c. oleo and crumble over filling
Top with walnuts or pecans if desired.
Bake 350 degrees for 1/2 hr.
Cool, or serve warm with cool whip

recipes.name: Schaum Torte
instructions: Bake 275 degrees 40-60 minutes
Makes 12 individual

recipes.name: Mexican Wedding Cake
instructions: Cream butter & sugar; blend in salt, vanilla & flour. Mixture will be stiff.
Shape into balls & place in small paper candy liners.
Place liners on ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake at 375 degrees 12-15 minutes.
Cool & frost with Browned Butter Frosting.

recipes.name: Browned Butter Frosting
instructions: Brown butter, remove from heat & add powdered sugar.
Cream to make frosting of spreading consistency.
Sprinkle with chopped nuts if desired.

recipes.name: Texas Sheet Cake
instructions: Combine in bowl: sugar, flour soda, salt. Melt butter, add cocoa & water.
Bring to a rapid boil.
Let cool & add dry ingredients.
Add buttermilk, eggs & vanilla.
Bake in 11 x 17 pan at 300 degrees for 25 minutes.
When cool, frost.

recipes.name: Frosting for Texas Sheet Cake
instructions: Melt butter; add cocoa.
Bring to a rapid bowl.
Remove from heat & add powdered sugar & nuts.
Spread, on cake while warm.

recipes.name: Self Frosted Chocolate Bundt Cake
instructions: Melt 4 T. butter in saucepan, stir in brown sugar.
Heat 'till bubbly.
Stir in corn syrup & cream; heat stirring constantly just to boiling.
Add nuts.
Pour into a generously buttered 10 (12 cup) bundt pan.
Beat remaining butter (6T.) until soft in large bowl.
Gradually beat in granular sugar until well combined.
Beat in egg yolks, melted chocolate & vanilla until well combined.
Add flour, Baking powder & salt, alternately with milk, beginning & ending with flour.
Beat egg whites until soft in a small bowl.
Fold into bake batter.
Spoon batter evenly over nut mixture in pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
Cool only about 5 minutes.
Loosen cake from edge with a small knife.
Place pan over serving plate, invert & shake gentle, then lift pan off cake.
Scoop out any nuts or syrup with scrappers & put on cake.
Serve with whipped cream.

recipes.name: Orange Tapioca Jello
ingredients: 2 small vanilla pudding mixes - not instant
instructions: Cook mixes in water until thick. Cool.
Add 2 envelopes Dream Whip, prepared as directed on package, & 2 large cans mandarin oranges, drained.
Mix well & refrigerate until firm.
This recipe can be cut in half.

recipes.name: Reese Peanut Bars
instructions: Blend well and pat firmly into 9 by 13 pan
Melt 1 pkg chocolate chips (probably 12 oz)
Frost

recipes.name: Orange Delight
instructions: Dissolve jello in water. Let gel slightly.
Beat in: 1 pt. orange sherbet
Add: 1 can cut & drained mandarin oranges

recipes.name: Lemon-Lime Cream Jello
ingredients: 1/2 c. whipping cream or 1 c. cool whip
instructions: Dissolve lime jello in 1/2 c. water. Pour into jello mold. Refrigerate.
Dissolve lemon jello in 1/2 c. water. Let partially gel.
Beat 1/2 c. whipping cream or 1 c. cool whip
Beat 1- 3 oz. pkg. cream cheese
Fold together, then fold into lemon jello mixture.
Pour over lime jello & Refrigerate.

recipes.name: Caramel Nutties
instructions: Melt butter in saucepan, stir in brown sugar, flour, BP, & vanilla.
Press into bottom of un-greased 9 x 13 pan.
Bake 20 - 25 min @ 350 degrees until light golden brown.
Do not over bake.
Melt Caramels in milk & spread over bars, sprinkle with pecans.

recipes.name: French Butter Horns
ingredients: 4 egg yolks beaten (save whites for filling)
instructions: Cut butter into flour, salt & yeast.
Add beaten eggs yolks, sour cream & vanilla.
Divide dough into 6 balls.
Sprinkle board with powdered sugar.
Roll each ball thin.
Cut circle into 8 wedges (like a pie).
Put 1 T. of filling on each piece and roll, starting with the broad end, rolling towards the pointed tip. Bake 25 min. @ 350 degrees. Makes 48 horns
Frost.
Filling:
4 egg whites
1 c. sugar
2 c. finely chopped nuts
1 t. vanilla
Beat egg whites until very stiff.
Add sugar slowly.
Fold in nuts & vanilla.
This filling must be very stiff.

recipes.name: Oatmeal Carmel Bars
instructions: Combine cake mix, oats & sugar in bowl
Carefully stir in oil & egg
Stir until everything is mixed together
With your hands put half of the dough into a well greased & floured 9 x 13 pan. The dough will be gooey.
With the back of a spoon spread the ice cream topping over the dough.
Now crumble the rest of the dough over the ice cream top

recipes.name: Lemon Bars
instructions: Crust:
Mix together until crumbly then spread into a 9x13 pan.
Bake in 350 degree oven for about 15 - 20 minutes, until crust is very lightly brown.
Filling:
Mix above ingredients well.
Pour over cooked crust.
The crust does not have to cool.
Bake about 25 minutes in 350 degree oven until filling is set.
After the bars are cool, sprinkle powdered sugar on top.

recipes.name: Kathy's Blonde Brownies
instructions: Cream together margarine, sugar, eggs & vanilla.
Add dry ingredients together then add.
Spread on cookie sheet.
Sprinkle with chips & nuts.
Bake 30 min @ 350 degrees.

recipes.name: Chocolate Fudge Tarts
instructions: Crust:
Combine flour, sugar & a pinch of salt.
Cut in margarine until crumb consistency.
Stir in yolk & vanilla.
Chill 1 hour.
Press into tart pans or bottom of muffin tins.
Fudge Filling:
Dash of salt, cinnamon & allspice.
Combine melted chocolate & eggs.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Spoon into crust & bake @ 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes.

recipes.name: Chocolate Scotcheroos
instructions: Combine above sugar and corn syrup
Cook in 3 qt. pan over moderate heat, until mixture begins to bubble.
Remove from heat & add peanut butter and Rice Krispies
Press into buttered 9 x 13 inch pan.
Topping:
Melt chocolate chips and Butterscotch morsels
Frost. Chill 5 minutes, then cut & enjoy.

recipes.name: California Dream Bars
instructions: Part I:
Mix brown sugar, flour and melted butter well & line bottom & sides of an un-greased 7 x 11 inch pan.
Press in firmly.
Bake 15 min. @ 375.
Part 2:
Beat eggs until light.
Add remaining ingredients.
Mix thoroughly.
Spread over baked crust.
Return to oven.
Bake 15 min. @ 375 degrees.
Cut when cool. Yield about 30.

recipes.name: Pumpkin Bars
instructions: Beat eggs, sugar, oil & pumpkin until light & fluffy.
Mix flour & remaining ingredients in separate bowl.
Add to pumpkin mixture.
Mix well.
Spread in 15 x 10 x 1 inch pan.
Bake 25-30 min. @ 350 degrees.
Cool
Frost with a reduced fat, cream cheese frosting (homemade or store bought).

recipes.name: Kathy's Brownie Recipe
instructions: Brownies:
In large bowl beat together the brownie ingredients
Combine & spread in jelly roll pan. Bake 20 min. @ 350 degrees.
Frosting:
Boil sugar, milk and margarine until 'drippy' about 2 minutes.
Add semi sweet and milk chocolate chips
Stir until melted.
Frost while warm.

recipes.name: Rhubarb Sauce
instructions: Mix together & let stand for 30 minutes
Cook for 12 minutes
Remove from stove & stir in strawberry Jello
Put in screw top jar in refrigerator

recipes.name: Caramel Layer Choco-Squares
instructions: In heavy saucepan, combine caramels and 1/3 c. evaporated milk.
Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until caramels are melted.
Set aside. Grease & flour a 9 x 13 pan.
In large bowl, combine dry cake mix, melted butter, 1/3 c. evaporated milk & nuts
By hand stir until dough holds together.
Press 3/4 of dough into prepared pan; reserve remaining dough for top.
Bake 12 min @ 350 degrees.
Spread caramel mixture over baked crust
Sprinkle chocolate chips over caramel.
Crumble reserved dough over top.
Return to oven & bake 15 min.
Cool slightly – refrigerate about 30 minutes to set caramel layer.
Cut into 36 bars.

recipes.name: Holly's Apple Bars
instructions: Mix brown sugar, butter, flour and oatmeal well into crumbly mixture.
Put half of the mixture into a 9 x 13 pan Save rest for topping
Mix all but apples together in saucepan.
Bring to boil & the mixture will thicken.
Add apples.
Pour over crust & top with remaining crumb mixture.
Bake 30-45 min. @ 350 degrees.

recipes.name: Brownies with Peanut Butter Frosting
instructions: Brownies:
Melt baking chocolate & butter in top of double boiler over simmering water.
In small mixing bowl beat eggs slightly; gradually add sugar
Add cooled chocolate mixture
Combine flour, BP & salt
Blend into chocolate mixture; stir in nuts
Pour into greased 8 x 8 x 2 inch pan
Bake 30-35 min @ 350 degrees
Cool
Double recipe for 9 x 13 inch pan
Peanut Butter Frosting:
Combine in small mixing bowl
Add vanilla & milk
Beat until texture reaches spreading consistency
Yield 3/4 c. frosting

recipes.name: 7 Layer Bars
instructions: Melt butter in 9 x 13 pan
Sprinkle crumbs evenly over butter
Sprinkle remaining ingredients in the order listed above
Bake 30 min. @350 degrees
Cool

recipes.name: Gingerbread Bars
instructions: Combine above ingredients.
Place in a Jelly roll pan, & bake 15-20 min @ 325 degrees.
Frost with powdered sugar frosting - cut into squares

recipes.name: Carol's No-Bake Cookies
ingredients: 1/4 c. evaporated milk or skim milk
1/2 c. carob chips or chocolate chips
instructions: In small saucepan, bring sugar, butter & milk to a full boil.
Boil for 1 min.
Meanwhile, mix oats, chips, peanut butter & vanilla in bowl.
Pour hot sugar mixture over oat mixture & stir well.
Drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper.
Makes about 18 cookies.

recipes.name: Aunt Ollie's Butter Scotch Icebox Cookies
instructions: Combine above ingredients
Roll in logs
Place in refrigerator until chilled
Slice and bake @ 350 degrees

recipes.name: Aunt Jennie's Sugar Cookie
instructions: Combine ingredients.
Chill dough.
Roll out on floured surface & cut to shapes.
Bake 350.

recipes.name: Peppermint Meringue Kisses
ingredients: 6 red & white crushed peppermint candy canes
instructions: Preheat oven to 200 degrees.
Cover cookie sheet with foil or brown paper bag.
Beat egg whites till foamy with cream of tartar & salt.
Beat in sugar one tablespoon at a time.
Beat 3-5 min. till stiff & glossy.
Do not under beat.
Drop by teaspoonfuls.
Sprinkle with peppermint, chocolate chips or nuts.
Bake 1 hr. 15 min. until dry.
Don't open oven for the first 50 minutes while baking or meringue will crack.
Cool completely on paper.
Makes 2 1/2 doz.

recipes.name: Ginger Snaps
ingredients: 2 t. baking soda in hot water
instructions: Roll in balls, dip in sugar & bake in 325 degree oven
About 8 - 10 min

recipes.name: Pecan Shorts
instructions: Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 23 min in 325 degree oven
Roll in powdered sugar while still warm
Place on cooling rack until cool

recipes.name: Molasses Cookies
instructions: Boil the syrup, molasses sugar and shortening for 10 min.
When cool add the remaining ingredients
Roll out on floured cloth, cut with cookie cutters. Bake 10 min. @ 275 degrees.

recipes.name: Thumbprints - Butterballs
instructions: Roll into balls – roll in sugar & place on cookie sheet.
Poke with finger to make a dent or place a walnut half in center of ball.
Bake @ 350 degrees for 15 minutes.
Fill dent with colored powdered sugar frosting if walnut is not used.
Cinnamon/almond variation:
Add cinnamon & use almonds.

recipes.name: Swedish Heirlooms
instructions: Roll into balls – roll balls in colored sugar & place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake @ 325 degrees for 15-18 min.
After they are baked, while still warm, roll in powdered sugar.
Cool on rack

recipes.name: Peanut Butter Cookies
instructions: Roll in balls.
Place on cookie sheet.
Flatten with a fork, cris-crossing the fork tines.
Bake @ 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Easy Apple Crisp
instructions: Mix apples, cinnamon and sugar in baking pan
Mix together: butter and brown sugar
Add flour
Mix with fork until mixture resembles coarse meal
Put on top of apple mixture
Bake @ 325 for 45-55 min
Can be used on any fruit pie filling mixture

recipes.name: Sandbaker
instructions: Press into little pans or tins.
Bake @ 350 degrees 10 min. until they just begin to brown.

recipes.name: Linda's Five Flavor Cake
instructions: Cake:
Cream butter, shortening & sugar until light & fluffy.
Add eggs.
Combine flour, B.P. & add to mixture alternately with milk.
Stir in extracts & salt
Spoon mixture into well-greased 10” tube pan & bake 325 degrees for 1 1/2 hrs
Turn cake out of pan immediately & spoon glaze over it
Glaze:
Bring to a boil & stir until sugar is melted

recipes.name: Italian Dunkers
ingredients: 6 eggs -- save 2 egg yolks for top
instructions: Cream butter & sugar
Add 4 eggs + 2 egg whites, then extracts & flour.
Dough will be very thick.
Shape into 4 long loaves on 2 cookie sheets lengthwise & roll to about 1/2 inch thickness
Beat egg yolks with a fork & brush over top of loaves before baking.
Bake 30 min @ 350 degrees.
Remove from oven & slice 3/4 inch wide, lay on side & return to oven, turn oven off.
Leave in until cool.
Great for dipping in coffee, tea etc.
Variations:
Add white chocolate chips, reduce sugar by 1/2 cup
Add chocolate chips, reduce sugar by 1/2 cup, omit anise & almond ext and use 2 t. vanilla
Use peanut butter and chopped peanuts instead of almonds
Add 1/2 c. dried cranberries & 2 T orange rind

recipes.name: Apple Cranberry Cobbler
instructions: Mix apples, sugar and cranberries together.
Combine remaining ingredients above & spread over apple/cranberry mixture.
Bake 1 hour @ 350 degrees

recipes.name: Glorified Ginger Cake
instructions: Cake:
Mix flour, cinnamon, salt, sugar, baking powder and baking powder
Cut in shortening (margarine)
Reserve 1/4 c of dry mixture for topping
Combine egg, sour cream and milk
Topping:
Use reserved 1/4 c of dry mixture & add sugar, scant flour and butter
Bake 15 min @ 375 degrees then turn oven down to 350 degrees until done.

recipes.name: Rosy Rhubarb Cake
ingredients: 4 c. rhubarb, cut in 1/2 inch pieces
instructions: Cake:
Combine flour, Baking powder & salt; cut in butter.
Add egg & milk.
Handle as for pie crust.
Take small pieces & line 7x II” pan with dough.
DO NOT ROLL dough.
Cover with rhubarb; sprinkle jell over rhubarb.
Cover with streusel.
Bake 40 - 45 min @ 350 degrees.
Streusel:
Mix together & sprinkle over rhubarb.

recipes.name: Holly's Twinkies
instructions: Bake yellow cake mix with pudding in a jelly roll pan or 2 - 9 inch rounds as directed.
Cook milk & flour till thick. Cool in refrigerator.
Mix shortening, margarine, vanilla and sugar until nice & creamy.
Then add flour & milk until fluffy.
Spread between layers.

recipes.name: Pinchme Cake (Monkey Bread)
instructions: Mix 1/2 c. sugar with cinnamon
Melt butter
Add 1c. sugar with vanilla: Keep @ low heat
*Cut biscuits into fourths & roll each piece in the sugar & cinnamon mixture.
Place in bundt pan.
After completing 1st pkg., pour 1/3 butter mix over pieces.
Repeat from * for the next 2 layers.
Last layer, no sauce; just dump the rest of sugar mix over top.
Bake 20 min. @ 400 degrees.
Turn over on plate when done.

recipes.name: Linda's Cream Cheese Pound Cake
instructions: Cream butter & cream cheese, add sugar & cream till smooth.
Add eggs one at a time. Add flour & vanilla.
Grease angel food cake pan or bundt pan, can also use loaf pans.
Bake @325 1 hr. 15 min.

recipes.name: Grandma Conklyn's Apple Cake
instructions: Mix flour, butter and baking powder, should feel like pie dough
Add sugar, egg and milk
If not soft enough to spread, add more milk.
Press into a 9 x 10 inch pan.
Cut up fruit and place on crust
Sprinkle streusel on top
Bake 15 min @ 375, then turn oven down to 325 degrees & bake until fruit is done.
May top with powdered sugar & milk glazing.

recipes.name: Mom's Sour Cream Cookies
instructions: Roll out on floured cloth, cut with cookie cutters
Bake 400 degrees 8 – 10 min

recipes.name: Ohio Buckeye's
ingredients: 12 oz. peanut butter (1 1/3 cup) chunky or plain
instructions: Combine peanut butter, butter, vanilla and sugar & roll into 48 balls.
Place on wax paper, refrigerate overnight (covered).
Melt chocolate chips and slab of wax in a double boiler:
Dip refrigerated peanut butter ball in chocolate, leaving a small center of the peanut butter showing.
Round toothpicks are sturdy.
Shake to remove excess chocolate.
Place back on wax paper.
When all are dipped, gentle pinch toothpick hole closed
Refrigerate before touching or picking them up

recipes.name: Chocolate Ice Box Torte
instructions: To make chocolate filling, melt chocolate in double boiler.
Add sugar & water with egg yolks well beaten.
Cook slowly until thick & smooth, stirring constantly.
When cool, add stiffly beaten egg whites.
Cool well & add whipping cream until stiff.
Pour into lady finger lined torte pan.
Refrigerate for 24 hours.

recipes.name: Company Cheese Cake
instructions: Crust:
Combine & press into a 9x 13 inch pan.
Cheese filling:
Combine first six ingredients & beat until smooth.
Blend in sour cream & pour into prepared crust.
Bake 35 minutes or until set @ 375 degrees.
Chill overnight.

recipes.name: Blitz Torte
instructions: Cream butter & sugar.
Add beaten eggs yolks, flour & milk.
Spread batter in 2 - 9”. cake pans.
Beat egg whites & add 1 1/2 c. sugar.
Spread over batter. Sprinkle with nuts.
Bake 20 min. @ 350 degrees then increase oven to 375 degrees for 20 minutes.

recipes.name: Petite Cheese Cakes
instructions: Combine softened cheese, eggs, sugar, lemon juice & vanilla.
Beat until smooth.
Place vanilla wafer, flat side down in a paper lined cupcake pan.
Put about 2/3 c. of filling in each.
Bake in 375 degree oven for 15-20 min. until dry looking on top.
Partially cook & put 1 T. cherry or other pie filling on top.
Refrigerate for 4 hours

recipes.name: Puppy Chow
instructions: Bring margarine & sugar to a boil & boil 3 minutes.
Line a 9 x 13 inch pan with soda crackers.
Pour boiling mixture over crackers.
Bake @ 300 degrees for 5 minutes.
Immediately after removing pan from oven, sprinkle with chocolate chips.
Let melt a few minutes & spread with knife.
Cool in refrig.
Break in pieces.

recipes.name: Elizabeth's Rhubarb Cake
instructions: Cream oleo and brown sugar
Add eggs and sour or butter milk
Mix baking soda, flour, cinnamon and chopped rhubarb
Sprinkle topping over cake
Bake 45 min. @ 350 degrees.

recipes.name: Spice Cake in a Jar
instructions: Cream shortening & sugar, add applesauce, water & eggs.
Mix well.
Mix dry ingredients in another bowl & add to first mixture.
Add nuts & raisins.
Spray wide mouth pint jars with pam & fill about 1/2 full.
This will fill 6 – 8 jars.
Bake @325 degrees exactly 45 minutes.
Remove jars one at a time & quickly screw the lid on each jar.
Let set until ready to eat.
When you use canning jar lids this cake has a shelf life of one year.
Great gift idea.

recipes.name: Mom's Cheese Torte
instructions: Mix dry ingredients
Pour batter in & stir well
Butter pan well with cold butter & press crumbs into pan, saving 1/2 c. for top.
Filling:
Bake @ 325 degrees for I hour. Turn oven off & leave in for one additional hour

recipes.name: Apple Delight
instructions: Mix flour, 2 T. sugar, butter and pinch of salt & pat in pan
Assemble apples, cinnamon, 1 c. sugar and nutmeg on crust & bake 1 hour or until done.
Cook milk, cornstarch, Vanilla, 2 T. sugar, egg yolks and salt until thick. Cool. Pour over apples.

recipes.name: Meringue
instructions: Beat egg whites & cream of tartar until stiff, adding sugar slowly.
When stiff, add vanilla.
Pour over custard mixture & bake 10 min. @ 400 degrees or until meringue is slightly brown.

recipes.name: Jello Torte
instructions: Crust: Mix flour, oleo and nuts & press firmly into 9 x 13 inch pan
Bake @ 350 degree for 15 min
Cool
Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar and half of the cool whip and spread over cooled mixture
Prepare Instant pudding as directed on pkg. but use only 3 cups milk
Top with remaining cool whip & refrigerate
The topping can be put on just before serving

recipes.name: Holly's Chocolate Eclair Torte
ingredients: 2 pkg instant French vanilla pudding mix
(if you don’t have the unsweetened chocolate, 1 square unsweetened chocolate = 3 T cocoa + 1 T oil)
instructions: Prepare the instant French vanilla pudding mix with 3 ½ c milk.  Stir in 9 oz. Cool whip.
In a buttered 9x13 inch pan, place a layer of graham crackers.
Pour half of the pudding mixture over cracker layer.  Add another layer of crackers & pour remaining pudding mix over crackers.  Top with a third layer of crackers.
Chill 2 hours before frosting.
Frosting:
Heat on low 2 squares (2 oz) unsweetened chocolate + 2t margarine until melted.
Remove from heat.
Stir in 2 c powdered sugar and 4T hot water
Beat until smooth.

recipes.name: Luscious 4 Layer Pumpkin Cake
instructions: Cake:
Make cake mix as regular cake mix, using the listed ingredients
Bake in 2 - 9” round cake pans. Cool completely. Slice in half, horizontally. (You can make ahead and freeze. Just don't slice the layers until ready to assemble.)
Filling:
Beat all ingredients, except cool whip.
After mixture is beaten, fold in cool whip.
Stack cake layers, spreading 1/3 filling between layers.
DO NOT frost top layer.
Topping:
Pour warmed caramel topping over top layer, allowing it to fall over the edges
Sprinkle with pecans.

recipes.name: Aunt Jennie's Chocolate Pie
instructions: Cook until thickened
Pour into baked pie crust
Cool

recipes.name: Pumpkin Torte
instructions: Crust:
Mix together & pat into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Set aside.
Cream cheese layer:
Blend ingredients in mixer
Pour over prepared crust
Bake 20 minutes @ 350 degrees.
Cool
Pumpkin layer:
Place all but the gelatin, water and powdered sugar in a saucepan
Mix & cook over medium heat until slightly thickened.
Remove from heat & add 1 envelope Knox gelatin which has been dissolved in 1/4 c. hot water. Cool mixture completely.
Using your 3 egg whites from Step 3 above, beat with powdered sugar until mixture is stiff.
Fold into cooled pumpkin mixture.
Pour over cream cheese layer and refrigerate.
Top with cool whip or whip cream if desired.
Best if made a day ahead.

recipes.name: Holly's Apple Pizza Pie
instructions: Make 2 c. flour recipe of pie crust & roll out to fit pizza pan
Peel & slice 5 - 8 apples & arrange on crust.
Mix the cinnamon, nutmeg and 1 1/2 c. sugar & pour over apples:
Mix the flour, butter and remaining sugar & sprinkle over the top
Bake 20 - 25 min. @ 450 degrees.

recipes.name: Pumkin Pie
instructions: Mix the white and brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, clove and allspice
Add the pumpkin, eggs and milk
Pour into 2 pie crusts
Bake 15 min. @ 450 degree until crust is brown
Reduce heat to 325 degrees for 45 minutes or until knife comes out clean when inserted into custard.

recipes.name: Aunt Jenny's Lemon Meringue Pie
instructions: Cook cornstarch, 1 c + 2 T. sugar, egg yolks, lemon juice, rind and water in double boiler until clear & thick.
Pour into baked pie shell.
Beat egg whites and cream of tartar
Add slowly: sugar and vanilla
When stiff, spoon over lemon, making sure the edges are sealed.
Bake @ 400 degrees about 10 min. (or until light brown.)
WATCH – it burns easily.

recipes.name: Fruit Pizza
instructions: Roll out dough to fit 12 inch pizza pan.
Bake 12 min. @ 350 degrees or until browned.
Cool.
Mix cream cheese, sugar & vanilla until creamy.
Spread on cookie crust.
On outside edge of pizza pan start arranging fruit in a row all the way around.
Then start with a different fruit for the next row and work toward center.
Drain pineapple.
Combine pineapple juice, maraschino cherry juice, mandarin oranges & Tapioca.
Let stand 5 min, then bring to a boil.
Let cool & pour over dessert.
Refrigerate until ready to serve. Cut like pizza.
Grapes & other fruit are okay. If using fresh fruit you can use orange juice or lemonade.

recipes.name: Holly's Chocolate Chip Brittle
instructions: Melt butter over low heat.
Add vanilla & sugar; mix well.
Add flour, salt & chocolate bits.
Press into 10 x 15 inch jelly roll pan-about 1/4 inch thick.
Sprinkle nuts over top.
Bake at 375 degrees 15-20 minutes.
Cool & break into irregular pieces like peanut brittle or cut into squares while still warm.

recipes.name: Chocolate Mousse Pie
instructions: Crust:
Combine & line a 10 inch spring pan, bottom & sides.
Refrigerate 30 minutes.
Filling:
Melt chocolate in top of double boiler or microwave, let cool to lukewarm.
Add 2 whole eggs & mix well. Add 4 egg yolks & whip until blended.
